text.p: Finnish hardware retailer and wholesaler Starckjohann Oy said in a statement on Thursday it had sold its entire majority stake in wood machinery wholesaler Penope Oy to Kontram-Yhtiot Oy's managing director Arto Jokinen.
It did not give the price of the deal, but said it would not have any significant earnings impact.
Starckjohann had owned 58.1 percent of shares and 50.5 percent of votes in Penope, its holding made up of 235,600 K-shares and 188,254 A-shares.
In April, Starckjohann had raised its stake in Penope to 58 percent when it bought 38,000 K-shares from Penope's managing director Jarmo Kivisto.

In a separate statement on the deal, Penope said its four K-shareholders, including Jokinen and Kivisto, had made an agreement to combine the company's K- and A-shares into a single share series, which would be quoted on the OTC-list.
Penope would also launch a rights issue to shareholders, employees, institutional investors and the public.
